lines.text: Well, uh, you see, she had amnesia when I met her. What's more, it recurred, you know, kept happening on and off. Why once I came home late at night. I got into bed, kissed her and she gave me a friendly smile and then said, "Who are you?" It was the friendly smile that burned me up.
Congratulations, honey. What a break, hunh? Two and a half fish out of the blue.
I couldn't hate you, darling. Unless you turned out to be a... female impersonator. And I'll bet you my bottom dollar you're not.
We have a special on jumbo banana splits today. They're *delicious*!
Ohh, I'm on a diet!
Oh, that's wrong, ma'am. You should *never* diet.
No?
No. You should force yourself to eat. More and more, all the time. Then you'll get to hate eating. And then you'll get thin without any trouble at all!
Why, I never thought of it that way!
Good! One "jumbo" coming up!
You're not a basket weaver, you're a soda squirt!
Don't you call me a "squirt"!

[Not recognizing Peggy as she comes out of the shop with a complete makeover]
Your car, mademoiselle?
"Miss mademoiselle" to you.

[Looks confused]
Oh...
Shall I phone the police?
No! You imbecile! Do you think I want every other paper in town building up her case, and spreading the story that I am an assassin?
If you can bring back the dead, Stuart, you can certainly get back your job.
I'll hold you to that, Mr. Snodgrass.
Don't try appealing to my mercy - I've got none!
If I turn out to be your daughter, I'm going to run away from home!

[sourly]
And I'll help you!
Don't you swear at me, Master Cornelius! Or you'll spend the evening in your room.
Don't worry, Baba. I promise you faithfully, I won't get married - till I find someone as nice as father.
Well, if you do, I hope you find someone with more sense.
Why, do you think I'm insane? Let you go away alone with a man who you feel is not your husband?

But don't you see? If I am alone with him, why, I can find out everything. I can trap him. Because he won't be suspecting anything. But it would be different if you were along, because he'd be on his guard.
But Carol, if I were to let you go, and something happened to you, why, why... I'd kill myself.
Are we having trouble with our car, folks?
Yes... Is there any place around here I can get this thing fixed?
Well, there's an all-night garage...

[with a hopeful expression]
There is?
Wait! Come back! You can have the room tonight.
Oh, that's wonderful!
But... we haven't any money!
Aw, forget it! I'll charge a little to building maintenance. A little to overhead, the rest to Mr. Popper, in bungalow 5.
you're Carole Burden, all right. You're not Peggy Evans.
How do you know?

Because Peggy Evans was a whining little coward afraid to face life. She was hysterical and selfish. You are the finest, the bravest girl there ever was. You were willing to accept me - a complete stranger - as your husband. You left your home, and your father, to come with me because you thought it was right. You're the most wonderful girl I ever knew.
That's all.
[turns and leaves]
[Last lines]
Oh, Johnny...
The name is "Bob," Carol.
The name is "Peggy," Johnny.
Maybe we'd better just call each other Mister and Missus.
Maybe talking at all is... just a waste of time.
[they commence to kiss]
